trend_summary: Across the sequence the territory remains predominantly agricultural with scattered villages. Built-up footprints enlarge slowly along main roads, but cropland still dominates. Some forest blocks shrink, replaced by fields, while minor new woodlots appear elsewhere. Road connectivity improves slightly; overall land use shifts are modest, keeping the landscape largely rural and low-density.
notable_changes: Village edges expand incrementally, adding clusters of houses along primary roads.
Several forest patches in the centre-west are cleared and converted to cultivation.
A few new straight road links appear, tightening the transport grid.
Isolated reforestation or hedgerow growth noted in the north-east quadrant.
Seasonal imagery indicates increased field fallowing in the most recent scene.
